revised_title: Investigation of Koji: A Japanese Starch-to-Sugar Conversion Substance
tldr: The authors investigated the process of converting starch into sugar using a Japanese substance called koji. Koji is made from steamed rice and a fungus, which breaks down the starch into soluble components. The study shows that koji has properties similar to malt-extract and can invert cane-sugar, hydrate maltose and dextrin, and liquefy starch-paste.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Microbiology and Biochemistry
